授業目的: This is an introduction course in statistics with an emphasis on the basic theory/ideas and practical applications of statistical methods. It is designed to provide students with the knowledge and analytical skills to interpret actual data in social science, mainly in economics. Topics covered in this course include descriptive statistics, inferential statistics, and regression analysis.
到達目標: Students will be able to understand important statistical ideas and basic econometric research by analyzing properly the data and interpreting the obtained results.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
This course consists of face-to-face sessions.
Students need to pre-apply for the course during 9/8～9/9.
I strongly recommend that students learn how to use Microsoft Excel such as making figures and tables and doing simple mathematical calculations by the 1st day of the class. Students are able to use some contents of PC exercise for their study provided by the Department of International Studies.

第1回:
This course consists of face-to-face sessions.

Introduction: What is statistics?
第3回: Lorenz curve, Gini index, some empirical examples
第4回: Sample average, median, mode, moving average, weighted average, geometric average
第5回: Variance, standard deviation, coefficient of variation, some empirical examples
第6回: Nominal/real values, growth rate, contribution rate
第8回: Basic idea of statistical hypothesis testing, test of correlation, some empirical examples
第9回: Basic idea of regression analysis, ordinary least squares method
第10回: R-squared, adjusted R-squared, t-statistic, some empirical examples
第13回: Statistical hypothesis testing (test of population mean)
第15回: Frontiers of actual data analysis in the field of research
